posts.post_content:
There are so many things you can do with this [Command](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Command), this card is incredibly amazing and completely worth the cost.   
  
It's like a cantrip version of [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell) and [Boomerang](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boomerang) in one, plus you can also play those two effects without drawing a card instead, or even either prevent your opponents creatures one turn from attacking and/or make yours afterwards effectively unblockable - while still getting the option to a bounce, hardcounter or card draw.  
  
That card is a constructed bomb and on the edge on being broken, yet as [the Jitte](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=81979) rather very powerful than overpowered.  
  
To quote Trancefo, that's indeed *pure blue*.
posts.html:
There are so many things you can do with this Command, this card is incredibly amazing and completely worth the cost.

It's like a cantrip version of Counterspell and Boomerang in one, plus you can also play those two effects without drawing a card instead, or even either prevent your opponents creatures one turn from attacking and/or make yours afterwards effectively unblockable - while still getting the option to a bounce, hardcounter or card draw.

That card is a constructed bomb and on the edge on being broken, yet as the Jitte rather very powerful than overpowered.

To quote Trancefo, that's indeed pure blue.

posts.post_content:
Wizards of the Coast versus Blue, round 7!   
Blue wins!  
Seriously, WotC has been nerfing blue since Onslaught and still arguably the most powerful card in standard is blue. Cryptic Command is blue's swiss army knife and, while not the best counter ever (it might sneak into the top 5...) it is still Commandingly (get it? :p ) good.

Posted By: mdakw576 (12/19/2009 10:21:02 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Love this card, why? Because counter spells take such perfect planning that sometimes you can't use one when you want to and then it sits there in your hand.. ie, you use it to soon, you don't have enough mana to play the counter spell and your creatures, so on and etc. With this card at the very least if you can't counter spell anything you can still use it to do something else, and I like that a lot.
